message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of designing optimal scalar linear codes for a communication network, which is a topic that falls under the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-categories. The problem involves leveraging the knowledge of side information of all the receivers, which is a common theme in the Signal Processing (cs.SI) sub-category. The paper also introduces the notion of joint extensions of a finite number of sub-problems, which is related to the topic of Combinatorics (cs.DS). Finally, the paper deals with the construction of optimal codes, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CC).
